results.title: ‘Our Goal Is to Keep the Regime on Its Toes’: Inside Belarus’s Underground Opposition

results.title: ‘Super Taster’ Who Lost Sense of Smell Is Helping Italians Regain It
results.abstract: A celebrated epicure in Italy was devastated when Covid-19 first stole, then warped his sense of taste. Through training, Michele Crippa has recaptured some of it and is now on a quest to aid others.

results.title: As Chinese Vaccines Stumble, U.S. Finds New Opening in Asia

results.title: South Koreans Now Dislike China More Than They Dislike Japan
results.abstract: There is growing anti-China sentiment in South Korea, particularly among young voters. Conservative politicians are eager to turn the antipathy into a presidential election issue.

results.title: The U.S. wants a U.N. meeting scaled back to avoid a ‘superspreader event.’
results.abstract: The annual General Assembly meeting would ordinarily attract scores of heads of state and other top officials to New York. But American officials say it should be mainly virtual again this year for safety’s sake.

multimedia.caption: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada and other leaders addressed the 75th annual U.N. General Assembly in a video in 2020 because of the Covid-19 pandemic.
multimedia.copyright: United Nations/via Reuters

results.title: Your Friday Briefing
results.abstract: A second day of protests against the Taliban.

results.title: In Photos: Afghanistan Under the Taliban
results.abstract: As the U.S. was winding down its time in the country, the Taliban swiftly retook power, reviving fears of a brutal and violent reign.

multimedia.caption: Taliban gunmen confronted protesters carrying the flag of the deposed Afghan government in Kabul on Thursday.
multimedia.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.title: Booster shots ‘make a mockery of vaccine equity,’ the W.H.O.’s Africa director says.
results.abstract: Coronavirus vaccine doses do more good by giving initial protection to people in low-income countries than by enhancing protection in wealthy nations, said the official, Dr. Matshidiso Moeti.

multimedia.caption: Many African nations have struggled to obtain vaccine supplies. A health worker in Kenya administered a dose of the AstraZeneca vaccine that was donated by Britain.
multimedia.copyright: Baz Ratner/Reuters
